pageContext.claim: “Senate Republicans are not voting on constitutionality or precedent, they are voting on desperately needed Border Security & the Wall.”
pageContext.analysis: The resolution that passed the House is about a constitution principle -- whether the president can override Congress's power of the purse. The law that allows for the resolution of disapproval gives Congress the right to block a president's emergency declaration, though the votes do not appear to exist for a veto override.
